column4: I got sick of Windows and decided to install Ubuntu, but I simple cannot get it to connect to the Internet (yes, I'm stupid), would anyone mind helping me out.
then its easy just plug it in and see if your ubuntu box gets an ip address
go and click System -> Administration -> Network
then on the properties, configuration select DHCP
are you getting an ip address assigned yet?
are you sure you have good working cable?
and you are sure your router doles out the IP addresses?
how do you know you have a good cat5 cable? what indicators you have?
any led let up to tell you its an active port you're plugged-in the router?
that led is glowing, on the correct port you are looking at? sure now?
whats the ip address assigned to your windows box?
thats doled out from your router/dhcpd server right?
then on that network manager select static for kicks and use lets say 10.0.1.17 for your ubuntu
